intro: Turnera cuneifolia, commonly known as the Mexican buttercup, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of the southern United States. It belongs to the Passifloraceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and bright yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. It is often found in the understory of tropical and subtropical woodlands. The species is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine for various purposes.
